title: Riot doesn't allow ESL to host tournaments in India?
body: So none of you may not know that esl, today announced a series of tournaments for various games (dota 2 , Csgo , hearthstone , just dance) throughout the year under the name ESL India Premiership...and some of us in the community wondered why they aren't hosting league...we approached ESL India regarding this and they replied back to us saying "Riot doesn't allow anyone to host tournaments in India" . but why? I just hope to get reply from Riot regarding this

replies.body:
First, and most importantly: Riot does not ban League of Legends events.  We want our players, anywhere, to play and enjoy the game.  I'm not sure what your source is (I also responded to someone on Twitter about this), but Riot has in no way "banned" or restricted ESL from hosting a LoL event.

We have support systems in place for events in regions we officially support - NA, Turkey, Korea, OCE, etc - as part of our community efforts.  These systems vary by region, and are usually determined by each region's local Riot office.  However, we don't support events in regions without a dedicated server and support team, because that's putting the cart before the horse.
So, basically, "do as you wish but it's your own stuff and we can't afford to care about it".

> [{quoted}](name=Photos of Ghosts,realm=EUW,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=I1aV2HyQ,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2016-05-07T20:05:18.968+0000)
>
> So, basically, "do as you wish but it's your own stuff and we can't afford to care about it".

It would be completely backwards to say "Hey come play our game - but sorry, your ping is bad, it's not in your language, and we don't know what's important to you."  We want the player experience to be amazing overall, and that means delivering on the important things first before calling an experience our own.  How shallow would that look if we say "We want you to play, but we don't want to take care of you?"

I didn't mean it as a criticism. Your answer seemed to me kind of vague and directed to calming down angers; I was trying to go for the practical translation, which I personally understood as "definitely not forbidden, but not Riot's matters as of now, do it yourself".

So yeah, Riot doesn't ban anyone from hosting lol tournaments and has never stopped ESL from hosting one. We're looking into it with ESL.  My immediate reaction is that we absolutely did not send a letter to ESL to tell them not to host LoL tournaments, but I will be up front and say that I don't know the details of the situation.  Regardless, even if someone lied, that doesn't mean that ESL has to start running tournaments or there will be a public resolution.  What kind of action are you looking for?
